news.title: Lab Achievements
items: Prof. Balestriero's collaboration with NYU CDS wins Best Paper Award at the ICML 'Building Physically Plausible World Models' workshop!
stable-ssl, our open-source SSL framework library, enters its first major refactor!
Welcoming new Computer Science doctoral student Leyang Hu!
The group website receives major UI changes and updates to its information!

funding.content: We are funded by federal departments and industry partners, including: Defense Advanced Research Projects Agency (DARPA), the National Institute for Neurological Disorders and Stroke, the National Institute for Mental Health, and the Department of Veterans Affairs.

logos.alt: National Institute of Neurological Disorders and Stroke

diversity.content: We are committed to creating an environment that supports diverse thoughts, perspectives, and experiences. Our lab seeks to recruit, support, and retain members from backgrounds historically underrepresented in sciences.

areas.title: Postdoctoral Positions
areas.description: Opportunities in representation learning, theoretical aspects of machine learning, and applied AI for physical sciences.

areas.title: Undergraduate Research
areas.description: Positions for students in computer science, applied mathematics, and engineering with passion for machine learning theory and applying AI for science.
